data.title: Washington Nationals' home opener is here! What to expect at Nats Park
data.meta_description: Baseball is back! The 2024 Washington Nationals' home opener is April 1 at 4:05 p.m.
data.text:
Baseball is back! The 2024Washington Nationals' home opener is April 1 at 4:05 p.m.

The Nats will facethe Pittsburgh Pirates on Monday as their first home game of the season.

RELATED |

Former D.C. Mayor Anthony Williams is set tothrow out the ceremonial first pitchand Mayor Muriel Bowser will give the call to “Play Ball!”

All Nationals' parking garages and lots will open at 1 p.m. Officials said thegates open at 2 p.m. but fans are encouraged to be in their seats by 3:30 p.m. for pregame ceremonies.

For the thirdconsecutive year,Dwight Clyde “D.C.” Washington will perform the national anthem.

There will be several pregame festivities likelive music,caricature artists, and lots ofphoto ops. Also, about20,000 fanswill receive a reversible bucket hat presented by PenFed.

You can purchase tickets .

GETTING TO NATS PARK:

The closest station to Nationals Park is Navy Yard-Ballpark, which is served by the Green Line.The station is likely to see a huge increase in riders.

If you're driving, note that there will be several road closures in the area:

The following roads will be closed from approximately the 8th inning through approximately 45 minutes after the conclusion of the game:

First Street from M Street to Potomac Avenue, SE

Potomac Avenue from South Capitol Street to First Street, SE

Northbound South Capitol Street from Firth Sterling Avenue to M Street, SE

Howard Road from Firth Sterling Avenue to Suitland Parkway, SE

Southbound I-295 - Exit 4 (exit to Suitland Parkway or South Capitol Street)

If it becomes necessary, the following exit may be closed intermittently:

Eastbound I-395 - Exit 1A (exit to South Capitol Street)

Motorists should also note parking restrictions. Look for signage.All lots, including the GEICO Garage and Garage C will open 2 hours and 15 minutes prior to the start of each game.

For more information, go .

INSIDE THE PARK:

Upon entering the ballpark, fans will immediately notice a new LED scoreboard, new LED boards behind home plate, and energy-efficient LED field lighting.

Nats Park has also received improvements to its speakers and audio systems as part of a phased approach that will extend through the 2024 offseason.

SEE ALSO |

The Nationals have also renovated and expanded its food options. Grab-and-Go Marketplaces allow fans to spend less time in line and more time watching the game from their seats.

Concessions have also expanded. Emerald Amor Cafe, Eli's Crepes, and Los Cinco Tacos are a few of the new vendors fans will find inside Nats Park. For a full list ofspecialty food and beverage options andpopular bars and restaurants, click .

The team said it is proud to support more than 40 local businesses through their concessions and beer programs.

WEATHER:

The First Alert Weather Team istracking a weather front that will move into the region Monday morning bringing chances of heavy rain with temperatures around60 degrees. As of 4:30 a.m., there is no word if the game will be delayed.

RELATED |

If you're heading to the game, you'll want to bring a rain jacket.

Download the to stay up to date with the latest forecast.
